    • newDatagramSocket

      public DatagramSocket newDatagramSocket(int port) throws SocketException
      Description copied from class: NetObjectFactory
      Returns a new DatagramSocket bound to the provided local port and the wildcard address.

      The provided local port must be between 0 and 65535 inclusive. A provided local port of 0 will let the system pick up an available port. An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the provided local port is less than 0 or greater than 65535.

      Documentation is based from DatagramSocket(int).

      Specified by:
      newDatagramSocket in class NetObjectFactory
      Parameters:
      port - the provided local port
      Returns:
      a new DatagramSocket bound to the provided local port and the wildcard address
      Throws:
      SocketException - if the DatagramSocket could not be opened or bound to the provided local port

    • newDatagramSocket

      public DatagramSocket newDatagramSocket(int port, InetAddress laddr) throws SocketException
      Description copied from class: NetObjectFactory
      Returns a new DatagramSocket bound to the provided local port and the provided local InetAddress.

      The provided local port must be between 0 and 65535 inclusive. A provided local port of 0 will let the system pick up an available port. An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the provided local port is less than 0 or greater than 65535.

      If the provided local InetAddress is null or a wildcard address, the DatagramSocket will be bound to the wildcard address.

      Documentation is based from DatagramSocket(int, InetAddress).

      Specified by:
      newDatagramSocket in class NetObjectFactory
      Parameters:
      port - the provided local port
      laddr - the provided local InetAddress (can be null)
      Returns:
      a new DatagramSocket bound to the provided local port and the provided local InetAddress
      Throws:
      SocketException - if the DatagramSocket could not be opened or bound to the provided local port

    • newServerSocket

      public ServerSocket newServerSocket(int port) throws IOException
      Description copied from class: NetObjectFactory
      Returns a new ServerSocket bound to the provided local port.

      The provided local port must be between 0 and 65535 inclusive. A provided local port of 0 will let the system pick up an available port. An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the provided local port is less than 0 or greater than 65535.

      The maximum length of the queue of incoming connections is set to 50. If an incoming connection indication (a request to connect) arrives when the queue is full, the connection is refused. However, the exact semantics are implementation specific. In particular, an implementation may impose a maximum length or may choose to ignore the maximum length altogether.

      Documentation is based from ServerSocket(int).

      Specified by:
      newServerSocket in class NetObjectFactory
      Parameters:
      port - the provided local port
      Returns:
      a new ServerSocket bound to the provided local port
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs in opening the ServerSocket

    • newServerSocket

      public ServerSocket newServerSocket(int port, int backlog) throws IOException
      Description copied from class: NetObjectFactory
      Returns a new ServerSocket bound to the provided local port with the provided maximum length of the queue of incoming connections.

      The provided local port must be between 0 and 65535 inclusive. A provided local port of 0 will let the system pick up an available port. An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the provided local port is less than 0 or greater than 65535.

      The maximum length of the queue of incoming connections is set to the provided maximum length of the queue of incoming connections. If an incoming connection indication (a request to connect) arrives when the queue is full, the connection is refused. However, the exact semantics are implementation specific. In particular, an implementation may impose a maximum length or may choose to ignore the maximum length altogether. The value provided should be greater than 0. If it is less than or equal to 0, then an implementation specific default will be used.

      Documentation is based from ServerSocket(int, int).

      Specified by:
      newServerSocket in class NetObjectFactory
      Parameters:
      port - the provided local port
      backlog - the provided maximum length of the queue of incoming connections
      Returns:
      a new ServerSocket bound to the provided local port with the provided maximum length of the queue of incoming connections
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs in opening the ServerSocket

    • newServerSocket

      public ServerSocket newServerSocket(int port, int backlog, InetAddress bindAddr) throws IOException
      Description copied from class: NetObjectFactory
      Returns a new ServerSocket bound to the provided local port and the provided local InetAddress with the provided maximum length of the queue of incoming connections.

      The provided local port must be between 0 and 65535 inclusive. A provided local port of 0 will let the system pick up an available port. An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the provided local port is less than 0 or greater than 65535.

      The maximum length of the queue of incoming connections is set to the provided maximum length of the queue of incoming connections. If an incoming connection indication (a request to connect) arrives when the queue is full, the connection is refused. However, the exact semantics are implementation specific. In particular, an implementation may impose a maximum length or may choose to ignore the maximum length altogether. The value provided should be greater than 0. If it is less than or equal to 0, then an implementation specific default will be used.

      The provided local InetAddress can be used on a multi-homed host for a ServerSocket that will only accept connect requests to one of its addresses. If the provided local InetAddress is null, it will default accepting connections on any/all local addresses.

      Documentation is based from ServerSocket(int, int, InetAddress).

      Specified by:
      newServerSocket in class NetObjectFactory
      Parameters:
      port - the provided local port
      backlog - the provided maximum length of the queue of incoming connections
      bindAddr - the provided local InetAddress (can be null)
      Returns:
      a new ServerSocket bound to the provided local port and the provided local InetAddress with the provided maximum length of the queue of incoming connections
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs in opening the ServerSocket

    • newSocket

      public Socket newSocket(InetAddress address, int port) throws IOException
      Description copied from class: NetObjectFactory
      Returns a new Socket connected to the provided remote InetAddress and the provided remote port.

      The provided remote port must be between 0 and 65535 inclusive. An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the provided remote port is less than 0 or greater than 65535.

      Documentation is based from Socket(InetAddress, int).

      Specified by:
      newSocket in class NetObjectFactory
      Parameters:

      port - the provided remote port
      Returns:
      a new Socket connected to the provided remote InetAddress and the provided remote port
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs in creating the Socket

    • newSocket

      public Socket newSocket(InetAddress address, int port, InetAddress localAddr, int localPort) throws IOException
      Description copied from class: NetObjectFactory
      Returns a new Socket connected to the provided remote InetAddress and the provided remote port and bound to the provided local InetAddress and the provided local port.

      The provided remote port must be between 0 and 65535 inclusive. An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the provided remote port is less than 0 or greater than 65535.

      If the provided local InetAddress is null or a wildcard address, the Socket will be bound to the wildcard address.

      The provided local port must be between 0 and 65535 inclusive. A provided local port of 0 will let the system pick up an available port. An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the provided local port is less than 0 or greater than 65535.

      Documentation is based from Socket(InetAddress, int, InetAddress, int).

      Specified by:
      newSocket in class NetObjectFactory
      Parameters:
      address - the provided remote InetAddress
      port - the provided remote port
      localAddr - the provided local InetAddress (can be null)
      localPort - the provided local port
      Returns:
      a new Socket connected to the provided remote InetAddress and the provided remote port and bound to the provided local InetAddress and the provided local port
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs in creating the Socket

    • newSocket

      public Socket newSocket(String host, int port) throws UnknownHostException, IOException
      Description copied from class: NetObjectFactory
      Returns a new Socket connected to the provided remote host and the provided remote port.

      If the provided remote host is null, the loopback address is used.

      The provided remote port must be between 0 and 65535 inclusive. An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the provided remote port is less than 0 or greater than 65535.

      Documentation is based from Socket(String, int).

      Specified by:
      newSocket in class NetObjectFactory
      Parameters:
      host - the provided remote host (can be null)
      port - the provided remote port
      Returns:
      a new Socket connected to the provided remote host and the provided remote port
      Throws:
      UnknownHostException - if the IP address of the remote host cannot be determined
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs in creating the Socket

    • newSocket

      public Socket newSocket(String host, int port, InetAddress localAddr, int localPort) throws IOException
      Description copied from class: NetObjectFactory
      Returns a new Socket connected to the provided remote host and the provided remote port and bound to the provided local InetAddress and the provided local port.

      If the provided remote host is null, the loopback address is used.

      The provided remote port must be between 0 and 65535 inclusive. An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the provided remote port is less than 0 or greater than 65535.

      If the provided local InetAddress is null or a wildcard address, the Socket will be bound to the wildcard address.

      The provided local port must be between 0 and 65535 inclusive. A provided local port of 0 will let the system pick up an available port. An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the provided local port is less than 0 or greater than 65535.

      Documentation is based from Socket(String, int, InetAddress, int).

      Specified by:
      newSocket in class NetObjectFactory
      Parameters:
      host - the provided remote host (can be null)
      port - the provided remote port
      localAddr - the provided local InetAddress (can be null)
      localPort - the provided local port
      Returns:
      a new Socket connected to the provided remote host and the provided remote port and bound to the provided local InetAddress and the provided local port
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs in creating the Socket
